page.title: 03ECOLOGY
page.content: The natural history of the Highstead Terrace. This is mostly, open arable land, well drained friable soil, a 'redsina'. Here and there are patches of deciduous woodland, and the remains of ancient hedgerows. The flora is typical of North East Kent.{ {ANIMALS:}Foxes, Badgers, Hares, Rabbits, Hedgehogs, Rats, Mice, Voles, Moles, Stoats, Weasels, Toads. { {OTTERS }have been seen in the last 15 years. Over 350 species of moths and butterflies have been observed. { BIRDS: all common wood field and hedgerow birds. Within the overall environment are 'islands' consisting of old gravel pits and valley bottoms with streams. These micro environments have their own ecologies. The Boyden Gate area seems not to be under threat from the modern world.
